did.unittitle: A note on the history of the Jefferson manuscript draught of the Declaration of Independence in the Library of the American Philosophical Society, 1898
did.abstract: Accompanying this reprint from A.P.S. "Proceedings" 37(1898):88-107, are facsimilies of the Jefferson draft of the Declaration of Independence; 3 original letters from Richard Henry Lee, Jr., to John Vaughan, 1836 and 1840; an original letter from Isaac Lea to Vaughan, 1840; a note on the manuscript by Vaughan; and two original letters between Vaughan and George Combe, 1841.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: I. Minis Hays was a Philadelphia physician and author and editor of books on medicine and Benjamin Franklin. He was Librarian of the American Philosophical Society from 1897 to 1922.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 20p. facsim. F. Reprinted July 21, 1898 from the Proceedings - American philosophical society, v.37. f.p.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monticello, Typed c. of L. 2p. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history... of the Declaration) Received letter from John Vaughan of the A.P.S. informing that R.H. Lee had deposited his grandfather's correspondence and papers, including Jefferson's draught of the Declaration of independence with the Society. (from original in Library of Congress.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 3p. and add., end. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history of...Declaration) Never had the original of the letter from Mr. Jefferson accompanying his draught of the Declaration. The copy sent the APS is an authentic one coming down from his grandfather. Proposal to reclaim Lee papers presented to the University of Virginia and give them to the APS. Proposed gift of Col. Morgan papers to the APS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 4p., add., end. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history... of Declaration) Relative to the draught of the Declaration and the copy of Mr. Jefferson's letter presented to the APS.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 2p. and add., end. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history... of Declaration) Transcribes a statement relative to the draught of the Declaration in the Athenaeum [i.e. A.P.S.] Statement printed: Hays, Note on... Declaration...p.7.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Washington, A.L.S. 1P.and add.,end. (see Hays. Notes on the declaration... no.8.) Forwards statement concerning R.H. Lee's draft of the declaration in the hand of Jefferson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Phila., Copy of L. 3p. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history... of the Declaration) Relative to the draught of the Declaration of independence which Mr. Lee had presented to the Society,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Hull, A.L.S. 1p. and add. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history... of the Declaration) Acknowledges letter giving history of the American Declaration of Independence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Phila., A.Dr. of L. 2p. (Bound with Hays, Note on the history...of the Declaration) Relative to the draught of the Declaration of independence in Jefferson's hand in the possession of the APS.
